propositions.text: A fisherman finds a dead body in a suitcase by the river.
The fisherman, Guo Xiaoliang, is fishing at dawn.
His dog, Heizi, becomes agitated and barks at the river.
Guo Xiaoliang believes his dog is scaring the fish.
He thinks he has a big fish when his fishing rod breaks.
The object that snagged his line is revealed to be a suitcase.
Heizi pulls the suitcase ashore.
Upon opening the suitcase, Guo Xiaoliang discovers a female corpse.
He recognizes the suitcase and decides to report the incident to the police.
Detective Gao Feng is introduced and expresses frustration with his current lifestyle.
Gao Feng is staying with Xiao Yue, who provides him with a "nutritious breakfast".
Gao Feng insists on having alcohol with his breakfast, which Xiao Yue denies.
He claims he needs alcohol to cope with boredom due to a lack of cases.
A phone call interrupts their breakfast.
The caller is Hu Bing, who sounds anxious.
Xiao Yue reveals she has established "Gao Feng Studio" to attract clients.
Hu Bing arrives in person, requesting Gao Feng's help.
Hu Bing reveals that a dead body was found in a suitcase by the river.
Gao Feng correctly deduces that Hu Bing has been promoted to captain.
Gao Feng and Xiao Yue go to the crime scene.
The crime scene is cordoned off, but reporters and onlookers are present.
Gao Feng questions the fisherman, Guo Xiaoliang.
Guo Xiaoliang claims he doesn't know the deceased and discovered her by chance.
He expresses fear and nervousness, seeking comfort from his dog, Heizi.
Gao Feng notes Guo Xiaoliang's unusual behavior, indicating he is lying.
Gao Feng deduces that Guo Xiaoliang knows the deceased and is hiding something.
Guo Xiaoliang's attempt to hide his fear by looking at the corpse suggests a connection.
Gao Feng advises Hu Bing to monitor Guo Xiaoliang instead of arresting him.
Gao Feng examines the body and surrounding area for clues.
The forensic examiner, Li Liang, provides preliminary findings.
The victim was naked, fought with her attacker, and died of suffocation.
There are abrasions on her body and skin fragments under her fingernails.
Xiao Yue analyzes the victim's injuries, suggesting she was attacked by at least two people.
Gao Feng infers the victim's identity based on the expensive suitcase and jewelry marks.
The victim was likely in a high-class profession or had a wealthy partner.
Gao Feng suggests she might have been a mistress or involved in a similar situation.
Gao Feng and Xiao Yue search for the dumping site.
They find a stone bridge with signs of a struggle and vehicle impact.
Black paint residue on the guardrail matches the suitcase's scratches.
Gao Feng identifies the vehicle as a 2009 Hyundai SUV with a damaged right headlight.
Gao Feng deduces the driver is involved in the crime.
Gao Feng decides to visit Guo Xiaoliang at his village.
Gao Feng uses his observation skills to locate Guo Xiaoliang's house.
He notes Guo Xiaoliang's familiarity with villagers and his dog's vocalizations.
Reporters are gathered outside Guo Xiaoliang's house.
Gao Feng reassures Guo Xiaoliang's grandfather and calms Heizi.
Heizi's unusual docility towards Gao Feng surprises the grandfather.
Gao Feng confirms Guo Xiaoliang's story about finding the body.
Guo Xiaoliang's fear and curiosity about the dumping site confirm his honesty regarding the discovery.
Gao Feng informs Guo Xiaoliang that the dumping site has been found.
Gao Feng tells Xiao Yue that he has confirmed Guo Xiaoliang is not the murderer.
The victim's identity is confirmed.
The victim's husband, Zhao Heng, reports her missing.
Zhao Heng presents identification and a marriage certificate.
Gao Feng and Xiao Yue interview Zhao Heng at the police station.
Zhao Heng claims he was drunk and didn't realize his wife was missing until later.
He expresses extreme grief and remorse.
Gao Feng and Xiao Yue find Zhao Heng's demeanor suspicious.
Xiao Yue suspects Zhao Heng is acting and not genuinely grieving.
Gao Feng observes physical signs of Zhao Heng being a gambler who stayed up all night, not crying.
Gao Feng deduces Zhao Heng's address from his documents.

concepts.name: fisherman
concepts.context: The primary occupation of the character Guo Xiaoliang.

concepts.name: dog
concepts.context: Heizi, Guo Xiaoliang's loyal companion, plays a significant role in the discovery.

concepts.name: river
concepts.context: The setting for the initial discovery and subsequent investigations.

concepts.name: suitcase
concepts.context: The container of the deceased, central to the initial mystery.

concepts.name: dead body
concepts.context: The core discovery that drives the plot.

concepts.name: detective
concepts.context: Gao Feng, the protagonist, embodies this role.

concepts.name: police
concepts.context: The official investigative body, represented by Hu Bing.

concepts.name: crime scene
concepts.context: The location where the body is found.

concepts.name: clue
concepts.context: Evidence gathered by the detectives.

concepts.name: investigation
concepts.context: The process of solving the crime.

concepts.name: forensic examiner
concepts.context: Li Liang, who provides initial findings on the body.

concepts.name: witness
concepts.context: Guo Xiaoliang, the fisherman, is the initial witness.

concepts.name: suspect
concepts.context: Various individuals are considered potential perpetrators.

concepts.name: dignity
concepts.context: The deceased's perceived character based on her possessions.

concepts.name: reputation
concepts.context: The victim's potential social standing is investigated.

concepts.name: lover
concepts.context: The possibility of an illicit relationship for the victim.

concepts.name: husband
concepts.context: Zhao Heng, the husband of the deceased.

concepts.name: grief
concepts.context: The displayed emotion of Zhao Heng.

concepts.name: lying
concepts.context: Guo Xiaoliang and Zhao Heng are suspected of deception.

concepts.name: gambler
concepts.context: Gao Feng's deduction about Zhao Heng's nocturnal activities.

concepts.name: car
concepts.context: The vehicle used to transport the body.

concepts.name: reporters
concepts.context: An intrusive element in the investigation.

concepts.name: village
concepts.context: The location of Guo Xiaoliang's home.

concepts.name: organization
concepts.context: Gao Feng Studio.

concepts.name: alcohol
concepts.context: Gao Feng's desire and Zhao Heng's claimed habit.

concepts.name: boredom
concepts.context: Gao Feng's emotional state.

concepts.name: suffocation
concepts.context: The cause of death.

concepts.name: betrayal
concepts.context: Implied motive for the murder, potentially related to infidelity.

concepts.name: money
concepts.context: A potential motive linked to the victim's possessions and lifestyle.

main_topics: Introduction of the Detective and the Case
Crime Scene Investigation and Initial Deductions
Identifying the Victim and Investigating the Husband
Confirming the Innocent of the Fisherman
hierarchy.structure: The document follows a linear narrative, presenting events in chronological order, with each chapter focusing on a different stage of the investigation. It begins with the discovery of the crime, introduces the protagonist and his methods, details the on-site investigation, moves to the search for further evidence, and concludes with the identification of the victim and the initial suspicions about the husband.
